title: Kyle Sandilands new TV show Trial By Kyle is guilty of low ratings
text:
He's used to stellar ratings on his long-running radio show with Jackie 'O' Henderson.

But the verdict is in and Kyle Sandilands new show Trial By Kyle suffered a dismal debut on Thursday night.

According to The Daily Telegraph, the Judge Judy-style program was watched by a mere 363,000 across Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Adelaide and Perth.

The verdicts in: Kyle Sandilands' highly anticipated TV show Trial by Kyle was guilty of embarrassingly low ratings after its dismal debut

The shock-jock's much-hyped TV return was embarrassingly beaten by a repeat episode of the ABC's British crime drama Vera.

The news comes after Kyle made headlines on Thursday when he declared he would be watching Love Island instead of the premiere episode of his own series.

In a bizarre twist of fate, Trial By Kyle managed to rank higher than Channel Nine's popular dating series, which bowed out at 298,000 viewers.

At least you tried: The much-hyped TV return of the radio jock was embarrassingly beaten by a repeat episode of the ABC's British crime drama Vera

But despite the small win, an industry executive conceded to the newspaper, 'given the publicity blitz, it is a very disappointing result'.

The source went on to reveal that in an effort to salvage the show Channel Ten will 'no doubt program encore screenings' in hopes of finding its 'video on demand' audience.

He added that, 'Thursday nights are a hard one to get', despite Gogglebox registering a whopping 790,000 viewers in the same time slot for Ten.

PSA: The KIIS FM host told fans on Twitter on Thursday that he would be watching the reality dating show instead of his own show

Trial By Kyle wasn't just a ratings misfire, it was also savaged by fans online, with viewers contempt stemming for its lack of substance.

'What the f**k, is this an actual show?' one person wrote on Twitter.

'Trial By Kyle would have to be the worst show I've ever seen on television,' wrote another person, while one fan demanded to know: 'Is this a piss take or what?'

Reality clash: Both Love Island and Trial By Kyle both aired at 8:30pm on their respective channels but his show nudged out the dating show in the ratings with 363,000 metro viewers

The show features the outspoken radio host presiding over a courtroom, giving his verdict on a range of topics from money quarrels, to botched Botox and larceny.

Kyle's return to Ten return comes after he was famously sacked from his judging gig on Australian Idol in 2009.

Trial By Kyle airs Thursdays at 8.30pm on Channel Ten
description: He's used to stellar ratings on his long-running radio show with Jackie 'O' Henderson.
authors: Joe Scek For Daily Mail Australia
